sources.title: Attack! (1956) Jack Palance · Eddie Albert
sources.description: The deadly clash between a cowardly, incompetent American company commander, who was protected by higher-ups, and his subordinates during a defensive battle against German SS troops in Belgium. A realistic, tough war episode with a polemical touch; psychologically profound and credible in its portrayal.

sources.title: Attack! (1956)
sources.description: Attack!" is a 1956 war film set during World War II, focusing on a U.S.  front-line combat infantry unit led by the cowardly Captain Erskine Cooney. The story follows the tensions between Cooney and his more competent subordinate, Lieutenant Joe Costa, as they face the brutal realities of combat and the consequences of leadership failures during the Battle of the Bulge.

metadata.Plot: During the closing days of WWII, a National Guard Infantry Company is assigned the task of setting up artillery observation posts in a strategic area. Lieutenant Costa knows that Cooney is in command only because of 'connections' he had made state-side. Costa has serious doubts concerning Cooneys' ability to lead the group. When Cooney sends Costa and his men out, and refuses to re-enforce them, Costa swears revenge.
metadata.Actors: Jack Palance, Lee Marvin, Eddie Albert
